sn2.1:1.2: On one occasion the Blessed One was dwelling at Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Park.
sn2.1:1.3: Then, when the night had advanced, the young deva Kassapa, of stunning beauty, illuminating the entire Jeta’s Grove, approached the Blessed One. 141 Having approached, he paid homage to the Blessed One, stood to one side, and said to the Blessed One:
sn2.1:1.4: “The Blessed One has revealed the bhikkhu but not the instruction to the bhikkhu. ”
sn2.1:1.5: “Well then, Kassapa, clear up this point yourself. ”
sn2.1:2.2: And in the exercise of an ascetic,
sn2.1:2.4: And in the calming of the mind. ”
sn2.1:3.1: > This is what the young deva Kassapa said.
sn2.1:3.3: Then the young deva Kassapa, thinking, “The Teacher has approved of me, ” paid homage to the Blessed One and, keeping him on the right, he disappeared right there.
